intro: Connarus bariensis, commonly known as the Bariensis Connarus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. Its leaves are usually opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. Connarus bariensis is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth areas.
